column4: once I plug the drive in it says something like : Mount error: etc
pastebin the error
Mount error, invalid mount option when attempting to mount the volume
what file system u have on that drive
I believe its fat32
and  what command u are using to mount it
I don't know how to manually mount so I have not used any command. Thats just what it tells me when I pop in the drive.
it can happen when u dont use "safe remove" in windows, u need to force mount then
how do I force mount?
1) Create a folder in /media using:-   sudo mkdir /media/force   2) Mount the drive on the folder using:-    sudo mount -t vfat /dev/path-of-drive /media/force
so where "path-of-drive" is, do I replace that with "8.0 GB MEDIA" or however it shows up under my system tab?
OMG THANK YOU!!!!!! Now would I have to do this everytime I plug in the drive?
sudo fdisk -l      its something /dev/.....
try to open "/media/force" folder
is there a command I need to do that
just use nautilus... file manager
I don't know what that is, sorry, I just switched to ubuntu yesterday
Places > Computer
filesystem > media > force
run  "sudo umount /media/force"  and replug usb drive, i should automount now
Thanks problem solved
nps
